channel.title: Client auto update?
channel.description: How would I modify my client to automatically download the client if a newer update of it is pushed out? I have done this for the cache and it works perfectly. Could you provide the code as well? Thanks.

item.title: Client auto update?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:5, topic:543750”][quote author=Ashi link=topic=662629.msg4428765#msg4428765 date=1402176930]

You’d want to use a separate application to act as the loader. It would compare local and remote versions and update if needed, then spawn the new process.

You could just check for updates every time the client starts up.

A simple way I’ve seen other people do it (if the client is hosted on a web server) is to have a txt file on the web server saying the version and then inside the client have like int version = 2; so if that does not match the txt file download the updated client.

[/quote]
Except that limits you to the client UI. A separate application gives you more creative freedom.[/quote]
What do you mean?

It’s not a method I would preferably use, but it would be simple for the OP to implement.

item.title: Client auto update?
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

You’d have to write this yourself. Just add an extra value to the log-in sequence and check it against the internal client version, if they don’t match run a separate process to update the files (since you can’t replace files currently in use).

As for code, google the code for a java downloader or something. I’d suggest you jar your client to make the downloading process much easier on yourself.
